/* givEn a list of NUmbeRs, return wHetHEr or NoT TheY ARe SOrteD
  in asCEnding oRder. If list HAs mOre than 1 duplICate oF the saMe
  numBer, return False. AssuMe nO negAtive NUMbers aNd oNLY iNTeGERs.
  Examples
  isSorted([5])  true
  isSorted([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])  true
  isSorted([1, 3, 2, 4, 5])  false
  isSorted([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6])  true
  isSorted([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7])  true
  isSorted([1, 3, 2, 4, 5, 6, 7])  false
  isSorted([1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 4])  true
  isSorted([1, 2, 2, 2, 3, 4])  false
  */
const isSorted = (lst) => {
  const len = lst.length
  if (len < 2) return true
  let i = 0
  let j = len - 1
  while (i < j) {
    if (lst[i] > lst[j]) return false
    i++
    j--
  }
  return true
}

/*
  givEn a list of NUmbeRs, return wHetHEr or NoT TheY ARe SOrteD
  in asCEnding oRder. If list HAs mOre than 1 duplICATE oF the saMe
  numBer, return False. AssuMe nO negAtive NUMbers aNd oNLY iNTeGERs.
  Examples
  isSorted([5])  true
  isSorted([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])  true
  isSorted([1, 3, 2, 4, 5])  false
  isSorted([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6])  true
  isSorted([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7])  true
  isSorted([1, 3, 2, 4, 5, 6, 7])  false
  isSorted([1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 4])  true
  isSorted([1, 2, 2, 2, 3, 4])  false
  */
const isUnique = (lst) => {
  const len = lst.length
  if (len < 2) return true
  let i = 0
  let j = len - 1
  while (i < j) {
    if (lst[i] === lst[j]) return false
    i++
    j--
  }
  return true
}

/*

  isSorted([1, 3, 2, 4, 5, 6, 7])  false
  isSorted([1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 4])  true
  isSorted([1, 2, 2, 2, 3, 4])  false
  */
const isUniquelySorted = (lst) => {
  const len = lst.length
  if (len < 2) return true
  let i = 0
  let j = len - 1
  while (i < j) {
    if (lst[i] === lst[j]) return false
    i++
    j--
  }
  return true
}

      evenOddCount(123) ==> (1, 2)
  */
const evenOddCount = (num) => {
  let count = 0;
  let odd = false;
  while (num > 0) {
    if (num % 2 === 0) {
      count++;
    } else {
      odd =!odd;
    }
    num = num / 2;
  }
  return (odd? count : count + 1);
};

    while (i < j && lst[j] > max) {
      j--
    }
    if (i < j) {
      temp = lst[i]
      lst[i] = lst[j]
      lst[j] = temp
      i++
      j--
    }
  }
  return sorted
}

const isHappy = (s) => {
  let len = s.length
  let sum = 0
  let i = 0
  let j = 0
  let count = 0
  while (i < len) {
    sum += s[i]
    i++
  }
  while (j < len) {
    if (sum % s[j] === 0) {
      count++
    }
    j++
  }
  return count === 2
}
